items: Place a barbell on the back of your shoulders, standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Slowly raise your heels off the ground, standing on your toes.
Hold the position for a few seconds, then lower your heels back down to the ground.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

content.title: Barbell Standing Calf Raise Form & Visual

items: Strengthens and tones the calf muscles
Improves ankle stability and balance
Increases ankle mobility and flexibility
Can help prevent injuries such as ankle sprains and Achilles tendonitis
Can be easily modified by adjusting the weight or using a step or platform for added range of motion

content.title: Barbell Standing Calf Raise Muscles Worked

items: Gastrocnemius
Soleus

content.title: Barbell Standing Calf Raise Variations & Alternatives

items: Single Leg Barbell Standing Calf Raise
Seated Calf Raise
Donkey Calf Raise
Smith Machine Standing Calf Raise
Dumbbell Standing Calf Raise

Toe Press on Leg Press Machine
